sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: A triangle has two equal sides of length 7 cm each, and an unequal side. If the unequal side is 10 cm less than the sum of the equal sides, what is the length of the unequal side?
message_2: The sum of the equal sides is 7 cm + 7 cm = 14 cm. If the unequal side is 10 cm less than the sum of the equal sides, then the length of the unequal side is 14 cm - 10 cm = 4 cm.
